hanzi-su-wiki:
阪

Значения

Склон

Мнемоника

Скат стены 阝, куда не залезешь, не перевернувшись 反.

Варианты

坂
purpleculture_pinyin:
bǎn
slope; hillside
склон; склон холма
rtega_mnemonic:
阪阪RShillside (farmland), slope
  • mound 阝 which can be used to reverse 反 an attack but in peace time serves for farming
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 反 indicates the sound; 阝 (hill) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
大阪 [ dà bǎn ]: Ōsaka, a city and prefecture in Japan
大阪府 [ dà bǎn fǔ ]: Ōsaka prefecture
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 阝 [ yì ] place, town, city
    • 反 [ fǎn ] reverse, opposite; contrary, anti-
heisig_constituent: heights, pinnacle, parthenon, acropolis, anti-, demonstration, cliff, crotch
heisig_story: This character is used for proper names, much as the English word "Heights" is. Its primitives: pinnacle . . . anti-.
koohiiStory1: If you´re scared of Heights, you don´t want to stay at The Pinnacle; you are anti- The Pinnacle. Primitive: The Pinnacle is a dream-like gated community at the top of a mount. This allows for innumerable stories for all the kanji with this primitive since you have a whole city to work with. Also prevents confusion with "mountain".
koohiiStory2: People are being displaced in 大阪 to make room for a new development, Osaka Heights, the pinnacle of modern Japanese housing. An angry mob of protestors are outside with Anti-Osaka Heights signs.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If you're anti-building, you're probably afraid of heights and slopes. The only downside to a building is that they're high and if you fall off of them you could die. So if someone says they're anti-building, they're really just anti-heights.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine standing on the edge of a very high building. If you feel sick or upset, you may be one of these anti-height people!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Another person you know who's afraid of heights is Han (はん) Solo. Now wait, you may be thinking, he flies a space ship! You're right, because he doesn't like to walk all the way up high buildings, it freaks him out. He flies up instead so he doesn't have to think about falling.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine standing at the top of a tall building with Han Solo. He's very afraid of heights. They make him nervous. Like something bad will happen if he were to ever stand above a big pit, high up.
Ru_trainchinese: bǎn: (графема) используется в названии города Осака; (книжн.) холмистый склон (вариант 坂)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the hill (⻖) you're anti (反) is a slope
humanum_full_description_en:
"Said Wen": "Ban, the slope is called Han. One is Zezha. The other is Yamawaki. From 𨸏return.

Bronze inscriptions were used as names, and Zheng Lingge for 20 years: "Zhang Ban, the right library engineer". "Jiyun": "Ban, or Congtu." The word " Ban " in Chu bamboo slips was added with Cong " tu " as a sign. The bamboo slips of Chu are used as the original meaning to indicate the hillside, "Shangbo Chu Zhushu IV. "Cao Mo Zhi Chen": "Xing Qiao (ji) [barrier soil] (barrier)" means passing the hillside and crossing the river bank (Li Ling).
humanum_short_description_en: Inscriptions from the " Fu " from " anti ", " anti " is a sound character, " Fu " is a signifier. The original meaning of " pi " is hillside.
humanum_full_description:
《說文》：「阪，坡者曰阪。一曰澤障。一曰山脅也。从𨸏反聲。」

　　金文用作人名，二十年鄭令戈：「右庫工師張阪」。《集韻》：「阪，或从土。」楚簡「阪」字加從「土」為意符。楚簡用作本義，表示山坡，《上博楚竹書四．曹沫之陳》：「行𡋴淒(濟)[障土](障)」，表示經過山坡，渡過河岸(李零)。
humanum_short_description: 金文從「阜」從「反」，「反」是聲符，「阜」是意符。「陂」的本義是山坡。

Lesson: 35 frameNoV4: 1294 frameNoV6: 1390 Strokes: 7 Jouyou Grade: JH 

《說文》：「阪，坡者曰阪。一曰澤障。一曰山脅也。从𨸏反聲。」 金文用作人名，二十年鄭令戈：「右庫工師張阪」。《集韻》：「阪，或从土。」楚簡「 阪 」字加從「 土 」為意符。楚簡用作本義，表示山坡，《上博楚竹書四．曹沫之陳》：「行𡋴淒(濟)[障土](障)」，表示經過山坡，渡過河岸(李零)。
"Said Wen": "Ban, the slope is called Han. One is Zezha. The other is Yamawaki. From 𨸏return. Bronze inscriptions were used as names, and Zheng Lingge for 20 years: "Zhang Ban, the right library engineer". "Jiyun": "Ban, or Congtu." The word " Ban" in Chu bamboo slips was added with Cong " tu" as a sign. The bamboo slips of Chu are used as the original meaning to indicate the hillside, "Shangbo Chu Zhushu IV. "Cao Mo Zhi Chen": "Xing Qiao (ji) [barrier soil] (barrier)" means passing the hillside and crossing the river bank (Li Ling).

阪字的基本解释

阪
bǎn
同“坂”。
崎岖硗薄的地方：阪田。

阪字的汉语字典释义

[①]［bǎn］
［《廣韻》扶板切，上潸，並。］
［《廣韻》府遠切，上阮，非。］
［《集韻》部版切，上潸，並。］
亦作“岅1”。
(1)山坡；斜坡。
(2)山腰小道。
(3)通“反”。与“正”相对。引申指邪术。

阪字的康熙字典解释

【戌集中】【阜字部】　阪； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页1346第11
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】?甫遠切，音反。【說文】坡者曰阪。一曰澤障。一曰山脅也。【玉篇】險也。【廣韻】大陂不平。【詩·小雅】瞻彼阪田。【箋】阪田，崎嶇墝埆之處。【禮·月令】善相丘陵阪險原隰。【戰國策】外阪遷延。【註】阪，坡也。【史記·范睢傳】右隴蜀，左關阪。◎按鄭風，東門之墠，茹藘在阪，其室則邇，其人甚遠。阪遠二字，廣韻俱在阮韻。朱註，阪，叶孚臠切。字彙、正字通仍之，云，又音顯。　又地名。【書·立政】夷微盧烝三亳阪尹。【左傳·昭二十三年】單子從阪道。劉子從尹道伐尹。〇按書傳訓作阪地之尹長，而左傳云，阪道、尹道，明是二地名，當從左氏。又釋文、詩、禮阪字，俱兼反、昄二音，惟書阪尹專音反。　又【廣韻】同坂。【集韻】亦同岅。?詳阪坂二字註。　又與反同。【荀子·成相篇】阪爲先聖。【註】阪與反同。反先聖之所爲。　又【玉篇】步坂切【集韻】部版切，?音魬。【集韻】陂也。　又【集韻】蒲限切，音版。阪泉，地名。【左傳·僖二十五年】遇黃帝戰於阪泉之兆。　又叶平聲。【

Rugged and thin place: Sakata.

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［bǎn］
["Guang Yun" cut the board with the help of the board, go up, and merge. ]
["Guangyun" Fu Yuanqie, Shangruan, Fei. ]
["Jiyun" section cut, Shanglu, combined. ]
Also known as "岅1".
(1) Hillside; slope.
(2) Mountainside trail.
(3) Through "anti". Contrast with "positive". The extension refers to sorcery.

Saka
Name meaning
Nothing.
bǎn
сущ. откос; склон горы; косогор; круча
阪有漆 на склоне горы растут лаковые деревья
阪险 кручи и обрывы
Radicals: 阝, 反  (building, anti)
Meaning Mnemonic
If you're anti-building, you're probably afraid of heights and slopes. The only downside to a building is that they're high and if you fall off of them you could die. So if someone says they're anti-building, they're really just anti-heights.
Imagine standing on the edge of a very high building. If you feel sick or upset, you may be one of these anti-height people!
Reading Mnemonic
Another person you know who's afraid of heights is Han (はん) Solo. Now wait, you may be thinking, he flies a space ship! You're right, because he doesn't like to walk all the way up high buildings, it freaks him out. He flies up instead so he doesn't have to think about falling.
Imagine standing at the top of a tall building with Han Solo. He's very afraid of heights. They make him nervous. Like something bad will happen if he were to ever stand above a big pit, high up.
